description_i18n.en: Fundamental concepts for the Azure Fundamentals exam.

correct_answer_i18n.en: A set of datacenters connected by a low-latency network.

options_i18n.en: A single datacenter in a specific city.
A logical grouping of resources for billing.
A backup site for disaster recovery.

explanation_i18n.en: Regions consist of multiple datacenters (zones) connected via a dedicated low-latency network.

question_i18n.en: Which expense model does Azure primarily use?

explanation_i18n.en: Cloud computing shifts costs from upfront infrastructure (CapEx) to pay-as-you-go (OpEx).

question_i18n.en: What is the scope of an Azure Resource Group?

correct_answer_i18n.en: A container for related resources for an Azure solution.

options_i18n.en: A global boundary for all subscriptions.
A security group for user permissions.

explanation_i18n.en: Resource Groups hold related resources for an application, allowing unified lifecycle management.
